channel.title: Haha need some help, please
channel.description:
[code]Hai everyone, i would like some help with my compiler.. iv'e trieddd a few codes, I'll show you all them, and someone can see what iv'e been doing wrong. :\
[code=]echo off title Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code]
That didn't work.. :\
And i tried this one..
[code=]@echo off Title compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe" Pause [/code]
Please help me, i'm new with all this stuff.
Sincerely, Dave.

item.title: Haha need some help, please
item.dc:creator: @daveeyy daveeyy
item.description:
@daveeyy wrote:

I never meant you flamed
And thanks for helping
add my msn:
Davestewart@Live.com.au

item.title: Haha need some help, please
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

[quote=“daveeyy, post:8, topic:435070”]Haha fml.
I really hate asking for help on moparscape, Because most people just hate on you, say disrespectful stuff, and shit like that.
So i don’t usually ask for help
haha.
Have no ideaaa what the hell is going on with my java c:[/quote]
I never flamed. But that IS the response that usually comes out of. I’m working on my own server. I gave you a quick help but failed. I can’t honestly be bothered to go indepth and try to help you. I’ve got other things to do at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Haha need some help, please
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

[quote=“daveeyy, post:4, topic:435070”]Says: Javac: - classpath requires an argument
usage: javac
Use - help for a lit of possible options
Press any key to continue…

If i use

[code=]echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe" -classpath Pause

I’m using Jdk1.6.0_25

And i’m laughing because, i feel stupid asking this question.[/quote]

I’m going to assume you are using a 317.

[code]
@Echo Off
Color 0f

Echo Starting Compiler…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
Echo.
Echo Finished!
pause[/code]

If that doesn’t work. Delete

-cp . and try that.

Read full topic

item.title: Haha need some help, please
item.dc:creator: @daveeyy daveeyy
item.description:
@daveeyy wrote:

Says: Javac: - classpath requires an argument
usage: javac
Use - help for a lit of possible options
Press any key to continue…

If i use

[code=]echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe" -classpath Pause

I’m using Jdk1.6.0_25

And i’m laughing because, i feel stupid asking this question.

Read full topic

item.title: Haha need some help, please
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

The top server is for 317’s only. If your server is a 317 model, all of the files will be in the same directory as the compiler. That compiler is guaranteed to work if so.
The bottom just called a compiler, but does give a file to compile. What is your Model Cache for your server? And what jdk are you using?

Go to C:\Program Files\Java to find out.

Read full topic

item.description:

Download Java. And I don’t see why you’re laughing in the title of this topic.
